lead_paragraph: The government has been trying to figure out how small-business owners can be persuaded to report their earnings more accurately. More audits may not be the answer.

headline.print_headline: Why the I.R.S. Fails to Crack the Small-Business ‘Tax Gap’
headline.main: Why the I.R.S. Fails to Crack the Small-Business Tax Nut

snippet: The government has been trying to figure out how small-business owners can be persuaded to report their earnings more accurately. More audits may not be the answer.
abstract: Internal Revenue Service has conducted series of studies in order to better understand how to persuade small business owners to report their earnings more accurately; largest share of estimated $458 billion in uncollected annual taxes comes from small business; among report's findings is that audits have little deterrent effect on tax cheats, but cause honest taxpayers to report less taxable income in subsequent years.
